channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Outside 73 and 75 Brondesbury Road, 22nd September
item.description:
Number 6 bin was placed outside my house over 2 weeks ago. The bin is broken and has been used as a place for rubbish but with no bags inside. It does not belong to myself or anyone who lives in my building and we are unsure where it has come from

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brondesbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Packaging dumped on street, 22nd September
item.description:
Saw male remove packaging from the pavement in front of number 62 Newick Rd to round the corner. He said he would clear it up, but he has not. It is blocking the pavement.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newick Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish overflow causing flees and other infestation in nearby houses, 22nd September
item.description:
The refusal bins haven’t been collected past many weeks has caused massive littering on the road as foxes are able to rip bags open overnight. It has caused an infestation issue in the surrounding houses and needs to be clear as soon as possible as it’s becoming a health and safety issue, many small kids live around the area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Witham Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several step bricks missing in the stairs ..., 22nd September
item.description:
....referring here to the stairs in Belsize Road/Swiss Terrace next to the secondary entrance to the Swiss Cottage underground station and Finchley Road underpasses. The very stairs that lead (from end of Belsize Road?Swiss Terrace) to Finchley Road and give access to other Finchley Road underpasses. This has been like this for ages! Yesterday I saw someone falling as a result and I was surprised the man (young) was not severely injured. An elderly person would have died. Spectacular!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairfax Road, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large amount of Fly tipping next to the bin cupboard, 22nd September
item.description:
There is a large and growing build up of fly tipping next to the bin cupboard for the flat numbers 12-26 Montana Gardens. Please can this be removed, it's been like this for a few weeks now?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montana Gardens, New Beckenham, London

item.title: Fly tipping - rubbish behind 5 Mallard Path, 22nd September
item.description:
Rubbish left behind house by garage for months. This is a serious health and safety issue, there are pests including flies and rodents. Cameras have been installed but this does not deter fly tipping. Rubbish now also being left in surrounding areas. Request assistance ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mallard Path, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet
